definition:
A *dynamical system* on $X$ where $X$ is an open subset of
$\mathbb{R}^n$ is a differentiable map
$$\phi: \mathbb{R}\times X \to X$$ where
$$\phi (t,\mathbf{x}) = \phi_t (\mathbf{x})$$ satisfies

-   $\phi_0(\mathbf{x}) = \mathbf{x}$ for all $\mathbf{x}\in X$ *(the
    identity function)*

-   $\phi_t \circ \phi_s (\mathbf{x}) = \phi_{t+s}(\mathbf{x})$ for all
    $s,t \in \mathbb{R}$ *(composition)*

[@1][@2]

Note that a *planar dynamical system* is the same definition as above
but with $X$ an open subset of $\mathbb{R}^2$.

[2]{} Hirsch W. Morris, Smale, Stephen, Devaney L. Robert: Differential
Equations, Dynamical Systems & An Introduction to Chaos *(Second
Edition)*. Elsevier Academic Press, New York, 2004. Perko, Lawrence:
Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems *(Third Edition)*.
Springer, New York, 2001.
